author: John Cross
title: Barcelona put Arsenal contract rebel Mesut Ozil on their summer transfer wish list
text:
Sport Barcelona put Arsenal contract rebel Mesut Ozil on their summer transfer wish list The German has just 18 months left on his current deal and talks over a new contract are stalling Share Mesut Ozil is yet to sign a new deal at Arsenal (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe 
Mesut Ozil has been put on Barcelona’s summer wish list. 
Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger is desperately trying to tie down Ozil to a new contract as the Germany midfielder has just 18 months left on his current deal. 
The stand-off has alerted Barcelona who have long been interested in the Gunners playmaker, having shown interest in trying to sign him twice before. 
The Spanish giants have made enquiries about the status of Ozil’s negotiations and are ready to make a move given any sort of encouragement. 
Ozil is Arsenal’s current highest earner on £180,000-a-week and the club are hopeful he will commit to a new deal. Ozil is in demand (Photo: REUTERS) 
But the German wants in excess of £250,000-a-week and has also made it clear he wants to know Wenger’s future before making a decision. 
If Ozil and Alexis Sanchez have not signed new deals Arsenal will face a major dilemma this summer whether to sell or let them run into the final year of their contracts. 
Bayern Munich have also been monitoring developments with Ozil who was on Barcelona’s radar last year and also when he joined Real Madrid. Ozil has already played in Spain at Barca's bitter rivals Real Madrid (Photo: Mike Hewitt) 
It has also been claimed that Real Madrid have a buy-back clause on Ozil and that Arsenal must inform them if they intend to sell to another club. 
Barcelona are searching for reinforcements and have also been linked with Real Madrid star Isco. 
Sanchez is also playing hardball on his contract negotiations and wants £250,000-a-week with Juventus, Paris Saint Germain and Chinese Super League clubs all keen. poll loading Will Mesut Ozil leave Arsenal this summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
